title: Son: The Guest
review: I would say this drama is by far the best korean drama I've watched.I was hesitant to start it at first because it was a horror genre series. Not my typical Korean drama genre I opt for. But this drama changed my perception for horror genre. It was so mind-blowing. Not because it was scary or whatever, it's just pure good acting and the storyline.Hard to believe they've managed to pull off a korean drama to be so good without any romance being involved. Yet, the chemistry between the main casts are so well portrayed and you can literally feel it. Still can't get over the bond between the casts and the soundtrack is so on-point. Brings out all the feels in you.You tend feel to feel so much mixed emotions while watching this. I'd cried my eyes out for few of the episodes as well.Overall, it's just a perfect drama with an A class plot. Some horror dramas tend to be illogical or fake sometimes but this was well-scripted with great acting by all the cast.Go watch to all that are having second thoughts on whether to start the series or not. You'll never regret it.

title: Son: The Guest
review: What an amazing series. The storyline was brilliant and griping until the very end. The acting was some of the best ive seen and it kept me guessing the whole time. The 3 exude friendship and love in a way that is not conveyed through the physical. Easily one of the best series ive watched

title: Son: The Guest
review: Amazing storyline and satisfying ending. Could not have asked for more. The horror part was definitely there, but in such a good way. Also the friendship part was very emotional to see throughout the episodes.

title: Son: The Guest
review: I really wanted to like this series. Actors are good as well as the cinematography. I also thought the main characters are great, with Detective Kang being my personal favorite. She def knows how to kick some a... even though her fighting skills seem to be almost gone by episode 6. N that's what ruined the whole series for me - the writing. First of all, I'm not sure about the cultural background but everyone at the police force apart from her seems to be completely stupid, then suddenly everyone is stupid - character decisions and reactions that make absolutely no sense at all. Worste being the demon/ spirit that keeps people alive and has his mandatory rant, just that people can be saved by some last minute deus ex machina event - it totally ruined the immersion for me. Overall a decent series with some huge plotting deficits, if u can get passed that, you're gonna have some escapism at least. As for now I'd give it a 4 if it wasn't for badass detective kang.

title: Son: The Guest
review: Great acting from the two male top actors and others also are truly great especially the possessed ones. Great effects that are actually done not much VFX or CGI.It kinda gets loose at the middle part but the starting and the ending is epic. Totally recommend it if you like exorcism and people getting possessed.Sound track is beautifully putted to intensify the feelings and there is no romance so if you don't like romance, it's your go to.

title: Son: The Guest
review: Other than the fact that this is not your typical K-drama, the Guest is not your typical drama either. Every episode of it will leave you on your seats, wanting more, making this one of those amusement park rides you don't want to let go of. The acting, directing and story are all woven together from end to the finish. Watch this masterpiece because it is completely worth it.

title: Son: The Guest
review: Very good if slightly drawn out show. It suffers from the same melodramatic tone that a lot of Asian shows suffer from but only occasionally and not enough to detract from the main storyline or the excellent actors from the main guys to the side characters.

title: Son: The Guest
review: I will surely missed the beautiful friendship bond of Hwa Pyung, Kil Young and Choi Yoon.Great series for this genre.

title: Son: The Guest
review: The show grips you from the first episode itself & has many layers to it. The highlight of the show is the bond between the 3 main characters & their struggles to reach their objective. The additional characters do their part well and contribute to the overall experience. The cinematography, settings, editing and atmosphere of the layout is superb. At times scary & intense but the heart of the story is the extraordinary bonding between the primary characters.Another area that adds up to the success, is the background score and the solo track 'Somewhere'. It brings a very emotional outburst to the show's flow.A tight storyline and beautiful performances by the characters brings to life a very enjoyable & thrilling experience...Overall, do not miss this show & I really hope the creators work on a season 2. Thank the creators & artists for making this such a memorable show.

title: Son: The Guest
review: I almost died from a heart attack. This series almost scared me to death. I don't usually watch horror themes but this series hooked me. The acting was superb. I loved every second of it. It kept me on the verge of a breakdown but I finished one chapter and had to start the next one right away. Although with the heart in the hand . Wow!!! I congrats you!!!

title: Son: The Guest
review:
I have rated this 10 out of 10 as I think this is one of the best horror I have seen so far. This is not a Korean typical drama. The story line, the acting are just perfect.
Even though the horror is about exorcism and possessed people highlighting today's society problems from a different perspective, the main story focuses rather on friendship. I strongly advise you don't miss this one!

title: Son: The Guest
review: It took my some time and a lot of thinking to start this one as I thought a horror centred plot wouldn't interest me. But obviously I was wrong. I enjoyed each episode of it, well done characters with no extra/irrational traits. Would've loved to have an extra episode of the 3 friends (main characters) just having free time and enjoying life. The ending was a bit rushed but I feel that's the case with most of kdramas. Can't complain tho. Had fun watching it, really recommend.

title: Son: The Guest

The pilot episode (ep.1) is arguably the most perfect pilot episode in Kdrama history. The tension in the story builds up and up and reaches a satisfying climax and conclusion. Recommended.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Korean Drama "Strangers From Hell" is a dark story that builds up to the great final twist in the end. The only thing that was missing was a bit of a more craziness of the main villain. All the others were mad enough to be triggering the insanity of the main character.The latter was the star of the drama and the sole focus of it, as his downfall was well-orchestrated, even though there were evidence from the start that something was off that he himself was trying to suppress.The performances, finally, were all great from everyone in the cast and the atmosphere pretty dark and suspenseful.So, overall, 7 out of 10.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Claustrophobic and unsettling in almost every scene. Even the most standard and regular shots or dialogues left me with a feeling of sickness. Whenever I thought I adjusted myself to the grim atmosphere they turned it up a notch. Could have been a bit more streamlined towards the middle/end episodes (esp not sure about some of the flashbacks or dream sequences). The finale was a bit underwhelming, not bad or anything, it was just not as creepy & subtle as the overall series in my POV. Nice twist though. In summary: Throughout creepy partly horrific at times unbearable.
Hell is other people, the lit. translation is a way better title and provides actually some meaning and logic to the overall story. If you look for a truly horrific and disturbing show go for it!

title: Hell Is Other People
review: This drama shows how atmosphere affects on human nature,how atmosphere badly forms or shapes daily lives. This drama focuses on studio apartment where people are weird and abound with suspicious activities. When a new guy named Jong Woo comes and starts living in it, he starts noticing weird people which also freaking him out. He is getting clues about missing people who have been missing while living in this studio. As day passes, he started hallucinating and he can also feel the changes in himself. He is becoming one of them. What's really going on this studio? Why people are getting missing?I was supper excited about this drama but I'm bit disappointed. There are some plot holes. I was expecting a bit, maybe a more interesting ending. However, the ending was ambiguous.But, I think, there were really a guy named Moon Jo who was serial killer. Moreover,he really killed guys and made bracelets out of their tooth. But somehow he found similarities between he and Jong Woo,so he tried to make him like him who can resemble his personality even better. But at the end Jong Woo killed Moon Joo. We can see, there were some visuals where Moon Joo was shown, maybe it was because finally Jong Woo becomes like him by killing four people.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: A young man moves from the countryside to Seoul to be near his girlfriend but finds it difficult to locate affordable accommodation. In desperation he moves into a rundown building in an area waiting to be redeveloped. He soon wishes he hadn't as the building is occupied by some very strange residents indeed. A well acted series which is claustrophobic and the tenants really are menacing. It is only a short series at ten episodes but I found it a difficult watch as there is no let up on the foreboding and dark air.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: This was one of the most intense and amazing psychological thrillers I have seen. The acting is fantastic, and the cinematography combined with a perfectly haunting soundtrack created an atmosphere that is crackling with energy and tension. I was absolutely spellbound from the first five minutes until the last. The story isn't necessarily that complex, and it could be argued that the ending was a bit predictable, but the journey is what is important in this series. The psychological torture and metamorphosis is so heart-pounding and brilliant that you just can't look away. I cannot recommend this highly enough.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I suppose this drama is saying something about the potential for violence within us all or something.It's well acted, has good characters. But for me, it never really catches fire. The ending was kind of a mild surprise for me.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Well, I hope Netflix is gonna keep producing Korean and Japanese horror/fantasy series.
I could totally feel how the main character would go crazy, living in that kind of building with that kind of neightbors (I'd have moved away sooner though).
No overacting, not overdramatic, really freaky ambiance.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Strangers from Hell (also known as Hell is Other People/ Tainuen Jiokida) based on a webtoon by the same name, was an excellent psychological horror drama, full of dark, gritty weirdness. It many ways it takes you down the rabbit hole, so to speak, delving into dark topics on the basis of human nature. Are we good? Are we evil? Perhaps there's only a fine line in between. Strangers from Hell showcases all that darkness of human nature and exhibits the increasingly troubled mind of our struggling young protagonist as he deals with other people, and their various forms of evil and darknesses.The synopsis is this. The story of a young man, Yoon Jong Woo (Im Si-wan) in his 20's who moves to Seoul after landing an internship in a company. While looking for a place to stay, he stumbles upon Eden Studio, an ominous cheap dormitory and decides to stay there as he is low on money. Though not thrilled about the quality of the place and its abnormal residents, including his next-door neighbor Seo Moon Jo (Lee Dong-wook), he decides to tolerate it until he saves enough money to move out. However, mysterious occurrences start occurring in the studio, causing Jong Woo to start fearing the studio's residents.Everything escalates from there. And what we get is such a masterpiece, though one that might be difficult to stomach, as its themes get increasingly darker and darker. Suffice it to say there are many references of murder, torture, cannibalism, and other forms of cruelty that can make most of us a bit squeamish. The slow build up, jarred with occasional but shocking scenes of violence or the macabre, makes the whole experience rather tense.As a whole, the show completed what it set out to do. Give us viewers a dismal and disturbing glimpse into human nature, as through a mirror darkly. It does so brilliantly. Combine the excellent cast and acting, great original soundtrack, with great story buildup, and elements that mix the mystery, crime, suspense, and horror genres, you get an utterly twisted journey such as this series. It definitely might not be for everyone, especially for the faint of heart. It gets under your skin.STORY: 9/10
CINEMATOGRAPHY: 10/10
ART/DESIGN/VISUALS: 10/10
MUSIC: 10/10
OVERALL RATING: 9.5

title: Hell Is Other People
review: It's good but too many scenes where the bad guys get all the breaks and the good guys make bad choices. Police are worthless as usual. And some of the content feels like "filler" to meet the hour long episode requirement. But watching something that did not follow the predictable American plotline was refreshing... Not sure if I liked the ending

title: Hell Is Other People
review: First of all, it's sick, dark and disturbing. Violence and creepiness is all over the show and the way it is filmed is sadistic and gritty. It definitely made an impact on to my heart and if you ask if it would make a good thriller, yes it would! It would make your heart pound incessantly that you would feel terribly sick after a while.Coming to the story, it didn't work out that much. No matter how much you try to convince yourself, the characters are stupid. You have to agree on that. Moreover, every character in this story is irritating like they all have some mental disorder and they lack something called 'Common Sense'.The series is also lagging at times with fillers that wouldn't add anything to the story and some creepy moments that wouldn't make any sense but are added to the screenplay either to give some cheap thrills or to elongate the episode.The climax is sort of clichéd and is not that good. Over all, Strangers from hell or hell is other people is a 'you've seen it all' series that would have worked out if it had been a film or mini-series.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: For me, the series was quite creepy, and unsettlingly sick. Sure there were plot holes that could have been connected and explained, but the visuals were fitting. Lee Dong Wook played quite the murderous character and some of his expressions were downright hideous.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I am almost through the 3rd episode and so far this show is incredibly boring. I dislike nearly every character, and many of them are so annoying I want to turn the sound off when they appear. Most of the scenes feel like meaningless, unconnected, pointless shots of people doing random things.This show has great ratings and reviews. When does this start to improve, because I don't know how much more of this I can stand. I feel like I am enduring this show, not enjoying it.It is too bad that Amazon got rid of the comment section when they bought IMDB and removed a lot of the good functionality.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
It's not easy to complete this series without feeling queasy, anxious and angry all at once. Lee Dong Wook (as Moon Jo) did an amazing job at being the highest culprit of all, and same goes to the actress whose role is the residence owner (can't recall her name at the point of writing). Hated her hair, her face, her grin, her disgusting way of making meals, and her pervertness towards the protagonist Jong Wu (Im Si Wan), the same hatred feeling for her in her role as the maid in the movie Parasite. The supporting roles of the hellish people in the residence are totally sickening-looking. Can't imagine if I were to be in the male lead's shoes.. i would have been discouraged by the stairs leading to the residence already. But yeah, this is a story, and I feel sorry for Jong U, wanting to search for a career in Seoul, but instead it took its toll on his physical and mental health, and it turned out to be a complete mess.In short, this series is a total psychological thriller. The production team deserves all the applause for such amazing acting + cinematography + set + lighting + everything else that made the series what it is.I just didn't like the ending though.. while I'm glad all the sick people are dead, I would like the male protagonist to have a little bit more self control over himself and his feelings, and know when to walk away. He really didn't know how to improve himself, argh that's annoying, really. Hated the fact that Moon Jo had successfully rubbed himself on Jong U, although he died.What the story didn't explain though, is the development of relationship between Ms Um and Moon Jo. How did he become a dentist? Is he really a certified dentist, or just some guy with know-hows to stitch cuts and pulling out teeth? Did Ms Um really raise him to tertiary education with that sort of mental state? Unexplained. The script just made Ms Um mentioned a little bit of her raising Moon Jo as an orphan (in episode 10), but it's really not enough to understand why Moon Jo and Ms Um are so sick and mental.So, my verdict: 7.7/10.
A thriller worth to watch.
Would I want to watch it again? Nope.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
1- our main character forgot to lock his door once
2- when the doctor killed the reporter he spit .. which would lead the police for his dna
3- the reporter didn't call the cops whatsoever.. also why he thought it was okay to get out of the office literally after a murderer just killed someone
4- the main character had plenty of time to contact with the female cop which was always there ready to help him .. but he didn't
5- why didn't the cops check the security cameras to see the main character getting dragged on the floor
6- police suspect that he's the main killer .. but why would a killer kidnap his girlfriend
7- when the girlfriend was kidnapped.. couldn't they watch the security cameras too ? Like the building she was living in looks expensive
8- what is up with the doctor .. he seems untouchable.. like he has super powers .. he appears and disappears whenever he wants
9- there was a scene where the crazy twin pull up a baggage and hug it .. that wasn't explained.. what was that ?10- if the crazy twin found out that the doctor knows everything.. why would he go to the roof to kill the main character and not the doctor? If it was in fact his intentions.11- what happened to the Christian woman in the karaoke room ? We never see her again
12- at the end .. did the main character lose his mind ? Does it mean he has split personalities.. why he keeps seeing the doctor even tho he's dead .. at the end did the doctor posses the main character soul ?13- if the main character cared so much about his girlfriend.. why didn't he after he freed himself .. run to her too and do the same ? .. he somehow leaves her tied to the chair like she isn't even there
14- what is up with the new guy .. he asks for a charger then we see him in his room using a charger that apparently works just fine
15- when the doctor killed the main character's boss .. couldn't they check the cameras ? It's literally right there
16- the reporter knew who the killer is but still didn't call the cops although he had plenty of time.17- when the main character knew that his boss died .. that means he has no job no more .. why did he stay in the city ?18-Even tho he killed the murderers , he's still a victim .. like everyone knows he hated that dorm
it was so obvious Yet the cops actually suspected him
19- another plot hole .. the doctor said to the main character , you did enjoy all the murders u have done here , what did that mean .. did the main character kill anyone else other than the murderers ?

title: Hell Is Other People
review: "One of the darkest thriller dramas", When I say it, I truly mean it! Cause dark doesn't always have to deal with utmost cruel murders and torture, there's surely a lot in the drama but it is something that haunts your soul. I had the same feeling after Midsommar. It is slow and intriguing that at a steady pace pierce into all your weaknesses and makes you shiver with horror.I truly feel the whole team did a great job, especially the story and ambience. How the story of a residence and its members which is not even a horror house (though nothing less than that) could trigger so many intense feelings and give you chills.I am awed!! And demanding more of it rn, I hope it gets renewed for more seasons cause it is one of my favourites. The actors did a fine job and are the ambience, that's definitely too creepy and suites great.A MUST WATCH!!!! (Not for faint hearts plzz)

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
The first half was intriguing but the other was disappointing.There were clear hints of what the end will be and I have no problem with that but it was done in a predictable manner.
Idk but it needed something else. The writer also threw away what he was planning with the new outgoing guy. He clearly had other intentions when he was shown with a lot of chargers but the writer cop out.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Why, why, WHY did he stay there after day one of all the weirdness?! And why is his girlfriend not listening to him and being so non-supportive?! I do enjoy two great actors in such different roles! This is why I gave it an 8 rating.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I won't spoil the ending, I will only say that I HATED IT!!!

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Confusing and illogical storylines, plot holes galore, idiotic and unlikeable main characters, ridiculous dialogue and the introduction of new characters later on that serve absolutely no purpose are just a few of the things that plague this series. Four out of the five stars I give this series were for the creep factor it and the music.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Lee dong wook never disappoints with his acting, he absolutely killed his rule (quite literally) he completely immersed himself in his role as a good actor does. Everything about his characters was believable, his creepy smile, sinister eyes, eery stance and gaze. All the other actors did very well too. I was gripped and on the edge of my seat at times because of how intense some scenes were. For those saying they don't understand the protagonist and why he didn't just leave, please watch carefully the reason why the dentist was able to manipulate him so well is because he saw himself in him meaning the protagonist already had problems the dentist just set off the bomb in his head. He was a ticking time bomb waiting for a trigger. 100% recommend for a break from all those Rom com clichés.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Not sure how this has a 7.9 rating cause it really isn't that great, but it is a fun show to watch. (wrote this while watching the last episode)Don't waste your time if you're looking for something scary or suspenseful cause it really is none of these things. But it's shot well has pretty main characters and hey it's Korean...If they would have told the story in 6 episodes it probably would have been really good, but this dragged while we all know how it will end.If you pass over the over acting of the main character the acting overall is pretty solid, right until the end which makes less sense than the IQ of all the characters of the whole series. In all honesty.. any regular Joe would have solved this case in half a day.It's just way too long and needed a bit more spice and a little more intelligence to be at least a little suspenseful.The ending made me change my 5 score to a 3 cause, well it's just dumb and makes no sense whatsoever and completely makes the whole series even less convincing.But, i still finished the whole damn thing, so at some level it was entertaining... Just not for the intended reasons i guess.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: This drama is like a movie. Great acting too. You will not be disappointed if you're in for the ride.Warning: You need tough stomach for this.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The creators of this show do such an amazing job of making the viewer empathize with the main character. You feel as disgusted as he feels, as frustrated as he feels, as tired as he feels. As life knocks him down, instead of making the viewer root for him to get back on his feet, they make the viewer want to tear down the world so that he doesn't have to struggle anymore. You really start to delve into madness with the character. Some of the best storytelling EVER. The villains make you want to hop in the shower and cleanse yourself. Like there should be a masterclass on it. I praise the writing, but the actors did their thing too. Lee dong Wook is always going to be amazing but the main character was so relatable. His facial expressions make you laugh just cause of how perfectly spot on they are. The ending does leave a lot to guess but I don't think that's a bad thing at all. I think this is a perfect drama if you're a fan of suspense.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I'm not a big fan of MHG, but I've read a few of her books, but I am sure she was an influence in the writing here.The tense buildup, the character development, the long climax with an intense feeling of real time emergency on several perspectives ; the pacing, the acting, the photography, the camera work are spot on on so many levels.Moon-jo is one of the creepiest villains ever caught on film (and casting Dong Wook-Lee, a model more famous for his heartthrob roles in teenage girls-dramas, was genius), and actress Jeong-eun Lee (of "Parasite" fame) as the housekeeper delivers gold.Watching this gem you are in for an intriguing, chilling, thrilling ride.

title: Hell Is Other People

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Beautifully shot, thought provoking thriller, great acting, great script. What else to ask for?
This isn't your average K-drama, this is what every thriller should be.

title: Hell Is Other People

It truly is a very veryy good tv series if you are into dark dramas you will enjoy this!

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The story hooks you in right away. The atmosphere is chilling and there is a sense of paranoia, making you wonder who can be trusted. However, it starts falling off once new characters are introduced halfway through the season. It ends with an obvious opening to a sequel, which detracted from an otherwise really creepy show.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I really loved the grim reaper from Guardian: The Lonely and Great God (Goblin) aka Lee Dong-wook so much so that I had to watch his Touch Your Heart and now this. This was a completely different role that he took on and I loved it. It was dark, his character reminded me a lot of Mads Mikkelsen's Hannibal Lector. A beautiful man with a dark soul. Yoon Jong-woo (Im Siwan) just needed someone to listen to him, to believe him, to understand his feelings. We see a 27 year old man go from being excited and happy about his new internship, moving away from home and closer to his girlfriend to a man that doesn't seem stable enough to be in society. If some of the characters just heard him out, would they be able to save him? I found myself being reminded of some of the bullying that is experienced in the adult working world. It's scary what the real world is actually like.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Bullies at work..
Psychopath roommates..
Such a living nightmares...
Feeling depressed watching this and yet I can't stop watching.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: This show is so creepy and the characters are so amazing! Fell in love with Lee Dong-Wook completely..... his character is the absolute best! I was grinning every time he was on screen and even though he was not the protagonist - I was rooting for him... I was watching the entire show waiting for him to smile one more time... Does that make me a psycho too??

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The revelation at the end was amazing. This show is comparable to the show MindHunter in how it shows the perspective of psychopaths/murderers. Great show, you will not be disappointed.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Korean movie industry is very good at adapting European movies into their local yarns and give them some local flavors without being 100% ripoff. This year we got ALIVE which is quite inspired by a French zombie movie, The Night Eats the World. And now we have Strangers from Hell, which deftly combined Rosemary's Baby and Naboer. But here the writer couldn't come up with a good ending on his own, so it ended in a quite mediocre way like this.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I absolutely loved this so much that this is my first ever IMDB review! Started watching this on a whim and I was obsessed after the first couple of episodes. The acting is absolutely incredible in this and the plot line is truly original. Definitely a 10 from me!

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Throughout most of this, my hand was over my open mouth. It's utterly shocking and terrifying in a way that's similar to the original Texas Chainsaw Massacre film.
I've watched (and loved) tonnes of k dramas and Korean films and this has the narrative punch of Oldboy, none of the innocence of Mr Sunshine and the familiar frustration of an overall inept police force.
Absolutely incredible cinematography, soundtrack and casting. I absolutely loved it (but I had to watch it in the morning only with tea and toast because it was so disturbing!!!!) Aggggghhh the twins and the pervert. Mother of God! I shudder....
Don't miss this.

title: Hell Is Other People

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I found this title as I was searching for "what to watch after Squid Game". My second Korean series didn't disappoint me. EP1 didn't pull me in, but from EP2 and on, I was totally in. By the final episode, I was so addicted that I had to rewatch it right away, which made me bump up the rating from 8 to 9.I loved the ending. It really justified a lot of things that I thought were strange or repetitive in previous episodes. Lee Dong Wook was perfect for this psychopath character, a pale face, soulless eyes, yet so beautiful and magnetic. Everyone ends up getting mesmerized, frightened by him and doing as he says. If Satan really exists, I think he has to be enchanting like him in order to lure people, right?This series was obviously made for a Korean conventional TV network, so it's pretty clean graphically. Although the subject and visual are super creepy, murders are not shown in your face and all gruesome objects are blurred, which was kind of laughable even to a squeamish person like me. I wished that they had done a little bit of editing for Netflix viewers. If it wasn't for the main character thinking out loud for every little obvious thing and redundant flashbacks, this series could've been so much better. I've heard rumors about a prequal on Moon-Jo in the works. I hope it's true.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: From start to finish, the show was incredibly well pieced together. The main setting at them goshiwon really captured the creepy feeling of someone watching you at every moment. From Lee Dongwook creepily staring through a small hole in the wall to the camera panning over / through walls, you felt like another person peeping into hell. At certain points you pitied the characters, regardless of their "morals" (which it seemed every character was twisted). Some parts of the show are confusing leaving me with unanswered questions, but doesn't that just add to the suspense? The last episode is a long and bumpy ride leaving me wide-eyed and honestly begging for a season 2!Overall, it's a binge-worthy show that will leave you feeling all sorts of different emotions. Dramas like this are a big harder to come by specifically because of how swift-paced the show is. No long and boring introduction to the plot, no gaps between conflict, and nothing unnecessary to the plot. Even the soundtrack is amazing!

title: Hell Is Other People
review: Personally, I don't really watch thiller, dark korean drama but Stranger From Hell was a whole new world experience for me. I've seen the webtoon and honestly the series itself was such a satisfying finisher for me. The plot, scenes, place, casts and soundtracks are all great. All of them is a perfect match and brought a special treatment about a group of psychopath that you didn't know what are their true motive until you finish all of the episodes. I still remember my pure reaction when they are about to kill someone, it's giving the fear on the back of my spine. Seriously recommended for people who love mystery and great plot.

review: This show is really different from what we use to see in Korean dramas,the cast is really good I actually liked every character, maybe sometimes I felt they were a little over the top but great nevertheless, the ending I think they could have gone further with a creepy storyline it's supposed to be ambiguous probably but I personally would've preferred a risky-er ending

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The start was promising. Creepy, with just the right balance between suspense and gore. Then the annoying stuff started. At first it was mostly bad acting, like the main character really can't act anything but "being normal". The moment he is acting drunk, injured, annoyed or angry his acting turns terrible. I mean, really really bad, "shouting at the screen" bad.But then the annoying stuff starts for real. The main character starts making stupid decisions. Reacting incredibly sluggish, missing multiple opportunities to stop this madness. And for some strange reason he could not just move from that building, when any sane person would just leave their things and go. I'd rather sleep on a bench or walk around the city all night, over sleeping there one more night. Or he could go back to his home town.And he doesn't try to contact the good police woman, who always shown that she is willing to help him. He even ignores her calls. And near the end, when people talk to him, he is almost constantly spaced out. I know this can be a realistic human reaction, but they don't portray it realistically in any way. Super annoying.Then when his girlfriend is kidnapped by the murderer, he first doesn't want help from his military friend. Then he acts incredibly sluggish before he goes inside the building, even though he knows that his girlfriends life is at stake. And he doesn't even try to look for any kind of weapon before he goes inside. And when inside, he and his military friend walk super slow, and get separated from each other (why??!!!!). Then his friend drinks from some bottle he found (why would he do that?) and drowse off.Then comes a scene where the murderer stands right in front of the main character, and the main character has a knife in his hand. But instead of killing the murderer, he just talks about how he will kill him but does nothing at all. He had SOOO many chances, at multiple occasions, to hurt the murderer but he never does anything.But the main character is not the only annoying one. The way the murderer seems "untouchable" is mind-blowingly annoying. And not only that, he seems to have some supernatural (ie unrealistic) ability to turn up in unsuspected places and can follow people pretty much anywhere without being spotted (except for when he wants them to see him). And he keeps insulting people, but they do nothing. He even touched the main characters Adam's apple, out of the blue, and the main character didn't push his hand away or even walk away. WTF?! Who would accept that?The police woman also did some stupid and annoying stuff, the main thing being staking out places on her own (there should always be at least two police officers!). And the reporter stayed in his car, in two separate occasions, parked in a desolate area, and didn't pay attention to people walking up to him.And in multiple occasions (two that I remember clearly, but I think at least one more time) one of the characters (main character, and the CEO) closes a door without it really closing and without checking it. Who does that? And the girlfriend of the main character chats with what she thinks is her friend, but she thinks he seems strange. But she still goes to some deserted place (I thought Soul has lots of inhabitants? Seems almost deserted, judging by this series), and only when she gets there she figures out she can call her friend instead of just texting (why didn't she call before she left her room?).I could go on, but in the end all these annoying things just were too much for me. I ended up wanting pretty much everybody to die. I did not feel any connection to the main character from maybe episode 3 or so. And I didn't even finish the last chapter, that's how annoyingly stupid it got.The first episode I would give maybe a 6/10, then it gradually went down, and the last episode I would give 1/10. So 3/10 overall. Would not recommend to anyone.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
I have mixed feelings about this series. The story is intriguing and the acting and suspense are all top notch, but the problem is the protagonist. He is such a wimpy pathetic weak and spineless invertebrate that very soon I was actually rooting for the bad guys to put him out of his misery. If he was a teenager, his sulking, weakness and inaction would make more sense, but for a 27 year old....Jeeeez, he's so annoying. I can understand why his boss is hitting on his girlfriend. Yoon Woo just doesn't deserve her.
So, I started seeing him as a village idiot and started rooting for the female police officer who is ten times smarter, braver, more articulate and decisive than the guy who is supposed to be the protagonist. Just do that - like me- and the show becomes much easier to watch and enjoy.

title: Hell Is Other People
review:
Upsides:
-Some really good acting here, especially from Park Jong-Hwan as the mentally disabled twin and Lee Jeong Eun as Mrs. Um.-Building of suspense is gripping and makes the story never feel slow, you always feel like wanting more of the story
-The main antagonist and the dynamic between him and the main character is played really well.-The lovely Lee Dong Wook is very nice to look at.-The creepy, foreboding atmosphere.-Hitchcockian feel to the story and characters.Downsides
-There should have been more episodes, as the last two felt very rushed, this drama definitely would have benefitted from having several more episodes, and more buildup to the finale, more mental decline of Jong Woo as Moon Jo kept messing up his life.-Too much time is wasted on pointless scenes of Jong Woo's and his girlfriend's co-workers and bosses making small talk.-Moon Jo should have had more scenes. Lee Dong Wook has second billing in this, but it felt like he didn't have enough screen time.-Should have elaborated more on the backstory of Moon Jo, Mrs Um and the twins, how those kids came to be in her care and how she messed them up so they became as psychotic as she is and became lifelong attached to her "family business"
-The pervert should have been killed off (by Moon Jo or Mrs Um) much earlier as there was really no point in him being in later episodes.-Siwan tending to over-act in certain scenes that breaks immersion.-Final showdown between Jong Woo and Moon Jo was rushed and should have been better coreographed instead of Moon Jo just pushing him around for five minutes before somehow getting cut in a second.-Moon Jo should have killed Jong Woo's girlfriend, it would have made a lot more sense and added more to contributing to Jong Woo's mental breadown.-Last episode relying on cheap jump scares instead of staying with the psychological thriller aspect
-Ending is too predictable and underwhelming, the "twist" is nonsensical.-"Twist" isn't really a twist...it's not convincing buying into the whole "Jong Woo becomes a psycho too" bs when all he did was kill the psychos who had been tormenting him and people close to him.Recommended if you want a good thriller that with characters and setting that feel both classic and original at the same time. It just lacks in certain areas and had the potential to be better.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The show really captives the feelings as well as gives the viewer really chilling perspectives. Really loved the show and can't stop thinking about it. 10/10 on my book.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: It's like every cheap Hollywood horror movies back in the day about a group of teenagers gets to an abandoned house when they obviously know they shouldn't.This movie could have end in the first few seconds or at least in every second after but not. The buildup is way too slow and repeated that can get a decent audience to feel detached from the main character. You can't help yourself but to ask why. There are too many fillers and too many ties that are used to complicate the plot but receive no answer after. The suspense is great in the first few ep. But the horror attempt is childish.If you watch a certain classic movie, you would know how this goes. Yet the development to get there is illogical.The edit feels very much inspired by Edgar Wright's Cornetto trilogy but there is a reason why Wright uses that technique on movie, not series. First episode feels amazing to watch but after the third ep., it feels almost suffocated.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: The acting is mostly on point. It's very creepy and atmospheric. The sound design fits the situations aptly and the visuals were on point save for some poor CGI at the end. The blurring is ridiculous but apparently that's standard. What I really didn't enjoy was the ending. The series started off with a lot of suspense and character building. Slowly some characters are left out and there are too many loose ends left unexplained. The show dragged on towards the end and I found myself trying to get through it rather than actually looking forward to watching it. The ending was very disappointing. Very ambiguous and some will say that you just didn't understand it or it's up to you to decide. I personally think it's lazy writing but hey that's me. Watch it for yourself!

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I have watched many Korean series in the past couple of years and nearly all have been very satisfying. I usually use the IMDB rating as a guide as to whether a show is worth watching. This one was horribly way off the mark.The first episode probably should have been a warning with super-annoying characters being introduced and a main character who is a complete moron for not getting out of the residence in the first place.Then there is the issue of one of the other major characters always turning up out of the blue and always just at the right time! It became way too coincidental and made me shake my head in disbelief that viewers could be expected to take this show seriously. I just finished watching the last episode and I still can't work out the motive for all the carnage that occurs.In summary, this was one of the worst Korean shows I have ever seen and my advice would be to avoid it at all costs.

title: Hell Is Other People
review: I'm watching Kdrama for over 8 years now and I can sincerely say that this is the best one I've ever seen. It has a really good actors and actresses, has a good script and the atmosphere in this series is smt else I swear. If you like to watch thriller this is the best choice you can choose
