title: Sweet Home
review: I watched this whole series in 1 day, less than 24 hours. This is too good and I totally recommend. Do watch. Can't wait for season 2.

title: Sweet Home
review: OK, I am going to start by saying that I'm a huge horror fan so this series really caught my attention. From start to finish it was a Rollercoaster of creepiness, scares, emotions and awesome character development. Never got boring for even a second and the monsters are really cool and deep if you are paying good attention to the story. Most monsters in horror movies don't even make much sense but in this series it does make sense. Because I got pretty tired of horror movies with the classic its just a bunch of meaningless jumpscares and enemies that are just there to fill the plot. No more blubbering. Go watch this series right now and you won't regret it. Excited for season 2 and what is has to offer! (Also I had to give it 9/10, - 1 because of some fight scenes being a little rushed. But still, a series definitely worth watching!)

title: Sweet Home
review: People who gave 1 point should finish the show. Honestly, at first I did not understand the subject because I haven't read the webtoon. I continued watching and the show really amazed me. It made me think about every single person's unknown inner world. One episode I hated one character and I was like die right now you are so annoying. In the other I cried for that character and prayed for him/her not to die. I loved watching them become a family. Character developments, understanding all of the characters' inner worlds step by step was amazing. In the beginning there was scenes about past and they are confusing I agree but you'll see that they are puzzle pieces and in the end they would complete the puzzle.

title: Sweet Home
review: Huge plot holes. The characters are so boring, insanely dumb and follow absolutely every cliche possible.

title: Sweet Home
review: The suspense at the end was great. Should get a second season. The series built the story quickly. This could have been more subtle. It held all the stories together but we're a bit here n there. The actors were great. Could get their feeling from their expressions. Please end the series don't drop it in between.

title: Sweet Home
review: If you've read the Webtoon, you will be disappointed. I was so excited for this adaptation to come out, but I can't believe they took great IP and did this. The original comic is subdued and spooky in how banal it seems until monsters appear. But this show rushes through character introductions and has a really garish lighting scheme and Party City mask monsters. It looks like an 80s B movie, so if you're into that this might be for you but has none of the original horror. Moreover, it's a tonal nightmare with a random Imagine Dragons' song used as a recurring theme. The flashbacks extrapolate too much of Hyun's character arc in the first episodes which ruins a lot of the mystery about his character. If you choose to watch this and haven't read the Webtoon, I would advise you to check it out to see how good this could've been!

title: Sweet Home
review: Disclaimer: have watched only two episodes. I think "Sweet Home," the apartment building where the story unfolds, is the actual star of the series. The details are amazing.

title: Sweet Home
review: Atmosphere of the series is one of a kind in comparison with many horror series that I have seen before. It's giving the audience entire. At the beginning, the series has really good pace in building the environment. It shows the empathy between humans are significantly important in this world. However the appearance of the monster is reduced, the series introduces new enemies. It throw off the balance of the movie and the dialogue are made unnaturally.

title: Sweet Home
review: I feel bad for the actors. They really did their best. The directing, however, is absolutely horrendous.The pacing is horrible it seems as if they were trying to finish everything in one season, but were running out of time and then towards the end started upping the pace until it's impossible to follow what is going on. There are sudden shifts in pace and scenes seem completely disconnected. Lots of important plot points are completely skipped. It makes a lot of the important parts of the story seem unimportant and skips all of the struggles that helped build characterization.The plot diverges heavily from the original webtoon, as if someone explained the main plot points to them from a moving car and they did their best to reconstruct some context for the show. New characters are introduced which steal roles from existing characters which results in poor characterization and character development for them all. The main character is tossed to the wayside and they barely show his progress. Many new characters are introduced whose only purpose are to drive your blood pressure up and be irritating; Hyun-soo's younger sister is rude and disgusting to everyone, the side characters who live in the apartment do literally nothing but cry, get in the way, cower in a corner when someone strong shows up, and throw a hissy fit when things don't go their way. They contribute literally nothing.Bass girl has her role completely cannibalized and her roles given to the firefighter girl. She ends up being a minor character and spends most of the show being sad about her dead lover, and suddenly having appendicitis and needing surgery which is performed without anesthetics.Later when the prisoners show up, they spend time building up the leader who then immediately gets killed in an unimpressive way. The guy with similar powers to the main character randomly starts killing half the charactersIn the end all of the actual characters of importance are dead, so when they get captured and the firefighter (only iportant character left) turns on them, I felt no remorse.Also, monsters show up and cause issues in maybe 3 or 4 episodes. They aren't nearly as dangerous or scary as in the webtoon, and don't actually do anything. After going into the basement they only find one monster. Once they start fighting, only then do they see that there's actually tons of them, and they start using car beeps from pressing buttons on the keys to distract a monster. But they didn't show them collecting the keys or planning to do this so it seems completely out of place. Not too long after them driving through the basement and crashing, it cuts to another scene upstairs and the next episode they mention the basement is clear and from that point on it's clear, but they never show them killing the monsters. Then, they don't them planning or preparing to make it but they make a armored car pouring tons of resources into it, and drive it out and it immediately gets destroyed by the protein monster. This happens in a cutscene taking like 20 seconds.The series is full of decisions like this that ruin the flow and make it confusing. It doesn't make it fun to watch for someone who hasn't already read the webtoon. And if you have read it, you would be confused why they changed things so much and destroyed any storytelling. That just begs the question. Who is this for?

title: Sweet Home
review: You want to see a good kdrama. This is not for you. Cheap soundtrack and graphics with a very bad cinematography makes this series an utter waste. The sound track feels as if I am hearing a bollywood action movie soundtrack. It was the worst of the worst. Never see this.

title: Sweet Home
review: I just wanna say Thank-you. It's just awesome. I want season 2 asap.

title: Sweet Home
review: I laughed to myself a little at the review that said the episodes "fell off" a bit after the first few, the reason being that they weren't being dazzled by the mutating beings anymore and had to use cognitive skills and follow a story. On the other hand, if there wasn't a story, then we would have the other half of the crowd whining and moaning that there was no story, just brutes in all fashions fighting non stop, which is great for some story, but, I want to be on the edge of my seat for real things, I want to watch people struggle as they see signs of their own infection. I want to see people turn on each other and likewise fight for one another as they see people they have come to care about become infected. This show was SO much fun, it doesn't follow the same recipe of, destroy the head, destroy the being, one bite turns you etc. That' was SO refreshing, THIS is why I love watching Korean and Chinese dramas, I find more unique stories. Sure, there are tropes to be seen, but it's not always the same over and over and this show is a great example. I am blown away that the ratings aren't higher on this series. How tf does the walking dead have a higher score than this? I like the walking dead, I watched it, but, it's certainly not unique and certainly not better than this.

title: Sweet Home
review: This id consider an original so far got all different kind of monsters but yet it still has to do with a virus....i like the fact they took virus zombie to mutating monsters lookin like theyd be coming up from the bottom of hell instead... not really a zombie show id say but i love it

title: Sweet Home
review: I actually read the webtoon after watch the trailer of this series. It's so good that i couldn't stop reading until finish. Therefore, the high expectation to this netflix adaptation. It only took 1 episode to make me sum up that this is very bad. I know cinema and still graphics are different media, but this is just too far. I can imagine that if i haven't read the webtoon, I wouldn't finish the first episode. Bad CGI (the monsters are not scary at all and more like stop motion dolls), very bad acting and directing. And yeah, the background music is very annoying. I did fast forwarding through episode 1-9, and found that they even changed the story into the cheesy one, and again with bad acting.

title: Vagabond
review: Cha Dal Geon has dreams of becoming a movie stuntman but things aren't going well. He has also adopted his young nephew Cha Hoon. Cha Hoon takes part in a trip to Morocco with his Taekwondo class; unfortunately the plane never gets there; somebody has caused it to crash. The authorities quickly determine that it crashed due to a fault with the plane. Dal Geon initially accepts this but when, during a trip for the bereaved families to Morocco, he sees a man who appeared in Cha Hoon's last video message from the plane he is certain that the crash was deliberate. He approaches Go Hae Ri, an agent of the Korean National Intelligence Service (NIS) for help and ultimately she teams up with him to uncover the truth. This will put them in frequent danger as powerful business interests and certain people in the government and NIS determined to keep the crime secret.I really enjoyed this series. The central story is solid providing plenty of excuses for impressive action. This action is nicely varied with car chases; shootings and martial arts fights. There is also a good degree of humour which doesn't get in the way of the story or feel forced. Cha Dal Geon and Go Hae Ri are great protagonists with an enjoyable chemistry. The other characters are solid; those identified as villains early of are suitably villainous and many other characters are nicely ambiguous leaving the viewer guessing as to whether they are good or bad. The cast is great; most obviously Lee Seung-gi and Bae Suzy as Go Hae Ri. Production values were high with overseas scenes clearly shot on location which adds an obvious sense of reality. The story does not end with the last episode; hopefully there will be a second season at some point. Overall I'd definitely recommend this to fans of action packed drama and political machinations.These comments are based on watching the series in Korean with English subtitles.

title: Vagabond
review:
Much of this show is very exciting and well written. Even though it's a complicated story and there are many bad guys and conspiracies it somehow keeps it clear enough with just the right amount of recaps to make things clear. Lots of movie quality action in Morocco. From rooftop chases to snipers to street ambushes and sieges. And the excitement keeps up all the way for 90% of show. Back in Seoul there is a bit of a slow down with the political and corruption things but it's not boring like some other K dramas when it deals with the misdeeds in high places. Maybe a few less bad guys would have been better - it seems most of the top politicians and the NIS are compromised. The political crisis with impeachment and all seems eerily prescient of what happened in the US.
Le Seung Gi is convincing in his action scenes and quite good in the quieter scenes too. Suzy Bae looks great here - the best she looked in all her different series.What many people feel was lacking about this show is that the ending is incomplete. It seems things were building up to a second season and many things aren't resolved yet. Hopefully there can be a second season or at least a movie to tie things up.

title: Vagabond
review: " Vagabond " was action packed, but had some parts of it that it wasn't that good.The drama started strongly, with two emotional episodes that shoot the interest high with the whole action and mystery plot. The action continued till the very end, but the mystery was pretty much solved or got uninteresting half way through. So, the rest of the drama was just an extremely thinly spread plot that was left open in the end, probalby suggesting a second season ( ? ? ). The romance, in addition, was just unecessary. The couple had not one moment together and the whole thing looked forced. The performances, however, were pretty good.So, overall, six out of ten.

title: Vagabond
review: This series started well with some good action and a relatively solid plot. The two leads are both attractive and likeable and deliver ok performances.The cracks started appearing after around episode 4 where more and more layers of conspiracy and corruption are "revealed".Basically the writers contrive to build in plot twists that are so farfetched and ridiculous to try stretch the story or over more episodes. Oh, and the action scenes get sillier and sillier. An example is when a car with 4 occupants gets ambushed by a dozen heavily armed men with military hardware, 3 still manage to escape largely unharmed. So silly.Not worth your time...

title: Vagabond
review: A bit of lag in the middle before it takes off. I'm not a fan of explosions and car chases, so if I say I really enjoyed the characters and action, then there must be more. And there is: heart, compassion, and justice with the survivors stepping up as well as the main characters. Recommended for a weekend binge with two fine stars and terrific supporting cast.

title: Vagabond
review: Its good so far but i can see them running out of plot and start stalling with stupid stunts that KD is famous for, enough with the over the top emotions with the men here crying one min and enraged the next.Like always the girls carry the show.okay done with this show they have ran out of story and ideals now all thats left is kidnapings, car wrecks, failed killings, childish anger outbursts and getting shit faced on the famous green bottle, then repeat it all over again

title: Vagabond
review: When it comes to a series that has all of the twists and turns, the action sequences, and the intrigue like "24," you really can't go wrong with "Vagabond."Much like "24," nothing in Vagabond is like it seems. Characters aren't as they appear to be, and those that you figured to be the "villains," you suddenly find everything turned around.A Korean airliner is taken down by terrorists, and the absolute distraught uncle, Cha Dal Geon, is determined to find out why as well as who is behind it. Of course, at first, nobody believes him until small pieces begin to fall into place. Geon is given some credibility as a movie stuntman who also teaches martial arts classes. However, he quickly finds out that martial arts rarely beats out a special forces soldier. I liked that they put some limitations on Geon. However, I was occasionally frustrated by how he took the lead in NIS investigations. That part was lacking in realism. I understand that he has a vested interest, but I doubt that NIS would give him such free reign and latitude. Still, Lee Seung-gi brings a character with a lot of charisma as well as genuine feeling to the role. He was excellent.Go Hae Ri is the "rookie" NIS agent stationed in Morocco. I had a harder time with her character. Suzy Bae is a good--but not great--actress. She seemed to find a hard time treading the line between depicting an agent who is inexperienced but trained. There were times when I just didn't find her depiction believable. I was hoping more for a seasoned actress like Doona Bae (Stanger) who brings intelligence and presence to her roles. Half the time Go Hae Ri doesn't seem to know what she's doing. And too often, she took a backseat to Geon, when she is the field agent! If you're stationed in Morocco as a field agent, you can't be that green. I thought the writers could have done a better job here. Bae also needs to broaden her range. Too often, she has an almost blank expression or the same expression in most of her scenes. I also quickly tired of her "16-year-old" reactions to the small, intimate moments with Geon.There were a number of character errors in the series. Never implement a character error in order to move the plot. That's a rookie mistake, and it was used several times in this series to the point when you can't help but shake your head at such carelessness.Several times, Go Hae Ri or Geon would return to their homes even when they know that they are targets. Do you really think an NIS agent would make this kind of a mistake?There was an instant when Go Hae Ri is assigned to protect Geon. She's drugged and knocked out. When she comes to, she immediately goes to the bathroom rather than checking to see if Geon is in danger...or even worse, not knowing if the assassin is even still in the building! If she has enough state of mind to easily make her way to the bathroom, I doubt she was disoriented.Another instant is when we have a sniper trying to take out a target. Geon and Hae Ri are protecting him. We already know that the sniper has orders to kill anyone, including Geon and Hae Ri. And yet, a professional assassin decides not to shoot them in order to kill her target?! I don't know many assassins who have such a conscience. It made no sense.I also wondered if male prison guards are allowed to work at female prisons in Korea.In any case, don't let these minor flaws prevent you from watching this adrenalin-boost of a series! There's scarcely a dull moment, and the rest of the cast, especially Kyeong-Yeong Lee (Edward Park) is nothing short of fantastic! I've seen him in several other series, and he's always tremendous!What really got me, however, was the season-ending cliff-hanger! So unlike most of the Korean series I've seen where I now have to wait for Season 2! I absolutely can't wait!

title: Vagabond
review: Male lead and female lead are both in my favour. Their acting is beyond doubt terrific. Action scene is captivating too.But seems to me the plot has bugs. I do not think a terrorist attack could so easily be mistaken as accident. And between the exciting action scenes there are boring scenes.The drama also makes me think of Iris, an extragravant production by LBH. It is also shot in Europe. In term of such big production the plot seems better and much closely tied.Anyway I still have much hope on the series. Hope it turns out to become a memorable drama.

title: Vagabond
review: Started reverting to K-drama tropes big time. The scheming corporations, aides and politicians would be right at home in a Joseon-era costume show, the beautiful but evil dames with the champagne lifestyle, plucky hardworking heroes who need a break, another bottle of soju and the right partner. But overall a glossy package with the foreign/Morocco touch and martial arts action give it a good score.

title: Vagabond
review: I will wait for season 2 and edit this review since there are so many questions left unanswered.

title: Vagabond
review: A stunt man sets out to avenge the death of his nephew, uncovering a massive conspiracy along the way.I won't go I to details as to the plot - you can read all about it in the other 10,000,000 "reviews" posted here; instead, I'll give an honest opinion of the series:The first episode felt like a bit of a drag, I kept wondering why bits weren't cut (which certainly would've saved some of the budget), and then recognising someone from mobile phone footage seen a week or so prior seemed like a huge stretch... but once the action kicked in, all was pretty much forgiven.And let's set the record straight: the action is what we'll all watch it for (albeit, the eye-candy of the female lead is a nice bonus).I've seen the entire first series so I can tell you: there are parts that drag, there are points where the story feels just too convoluted, where the tone shifts almost to comedy for no reason, or gets too cute, or where the action lets up too much, or the action seems too ridiculous, but overall, it's a decent series worth your time if you're into this kind of thing.However, the series could've been tighter - one or two episodes easily could've been shaved off for cuts that probably should have been made - and it is very far from perfect, hence the 6 rating.That said, it held my attention until the end (just about) and there are many out there who would overlook all the concerns I've mentioned, simply because TV & cinema is full of so much s**t nowadays! This probably explains all the 10 ratings you'll see here, even though Vagabond is merely an entertaining series one could easily skip.

title: Vagabond
review: This was action-packed and there wasn't a dull moment in any of the episodes. The cast was also incredible, with everyone being top notch performers. It had everything you want in a great show: great writing, characterisation, pacing and plot twists to keep you engaged throughout the entire thing. Also, this is probably an unpopular opinion but I really liked the ending. It came back full circle and even though the male lead and female lead had budding feelings for each other towards the end of the show, they ended up being torn apart by their circumstances. And although it wasn't shown whether the villain was defeated or not at the end, I think that it would've been too drawn out if they had continued the show to completion. I'm happy enough to believe that the villains eventually tasted their own medicine but if there's a season 2 in the future, that would be fun too.

title: Vagabond
review: Korean dramas excel at labyrinthine plots offering multiple layers of suspicion and suspense. This quality is deployed to full action-packed effect here. If action is your thing then don't miss this series.There is also an engaging relationship between the two main characters which adds another dimension to the story.The ending clearly sets up a second series and I am very much looking forward to that.

title: Vagabond
review: This movies throws some very human imperfections into the assassin trope. The protagonist is far, far from perfect, but is just appropriately skilled to survive in pursuing justice in this world of assassins and corruption. It did get rather convoluted, and some of the course of events were really a stretch. Alliances kept shifting, and no one was beyond suspicion. Who you thought might be trustworthy was not. The president's total self absorption was almost funny. In the end, if you just accept the weird musical roles for their over-the-topness, it is fun. Well enacted, and good production value. I would peg it at 8.5 stars,

title: Vagabond
review: This is pretty tense and I have to admit I did shed a few tears, so good acting (but, as a parent I am susceptible to some of the emotional manipulations used). The plot is about greed and corruption, both corporate and political. It seems the major corporations involved will pretty much do anything and every politician can be blackmailed or corrupted. I haven't been this disgusted with politicians and secret agencies since I watched Scandal (2012).I'm only half way through the first season and it is keeping me entertained, so that is much more than most shows. If you can put up with a lot of "deus ex machina" then this show is for you!

title: Vagabond
review: I really wanted to like this series a lot more. It has an interesting premise, a relatable and sympathetic main character, and a relatively good production value.The good: Generally good acting - at least by the Korean actors. For some reason the non-Korean actors seem to have very little acting ability. A good supporting cast, particularly the feisty NIS agent. Occasionally witty and funny dialogues. Believable actions and reactions of people.The bad: Shaky camera work. Please stop with this - unless you really know what you're doing, just don't use it. In this case, the shakiness is sloppy and detracts from the action rather than adds to it. I actually ended up having a headache when watching those scenes.Noteworthy: One of the central characters speaks pretty good Arabic and Spanish, which is keeping in line with their role. Kudos to the series producers for doing this. It might seem like a small detail, but it is a really important one that makes this series believable.Rating: A solid 7 for now with the hope that the series will improve. I enjoy underdog stories, so naturally I'm rooting for this series to get better.

title: Vagabond
review: This is quite impressive. The story, acting, action and direction are comparable to shows like Bourne Identity and Mission Impossible. The passion of Cha Dal Geon (Lee Seung-gi) draws you in. Bae Suzy as Go Hae-ri has perfected the part of an ingenue who turns out to be and know much more than she lets on.My only complaint is that the ending begs for a second season.

title: Vagabond
review:
This story begins with a crash: An airplane crash. Cha Gal-geon lost a ward/nephew he was raising to this tragedy. He travels with other mourners to the site of the impact, which is Morocco. As soon as he lands there, he recognizes a man that appeared in a video that his nephew sent him from the plane, prior to the crash. If this man had been on the plane, he should be dead, not walking around Morocco.Go Hae-ri works at the South Korean Embassy in Morocco. She's actually a fledgling intelligence officer. She is with the crew assisting the mourners. She meets Cha Gal-geon and they eventually work together to bring the baddies down.You would think that 16+ hours would be enough, but more and more baddies surface..... Anyway, the show is not complete. Season 2 has not been announced yet, but they are looking into it, and they know the fans want it.This show is exciting and well scripted. It has action, intrigue, displays of the worst and best of humanity, and the unfulfilled promise of some romance.It's difficult to tell a thrilling tale without being a little outlandish. They didn't get so crazy that it got in the way. The plot progresses without too many bumps in the road, yet it is still quite intricate.The action and fight scenes are good. Like most action thrillers, they should have been in ICU or dead several times over, yet they manage to keep going. It's the usual trope for the genre. Why fight it anymore?The only lasting disappointment you are likely to experience from fighting villains and corruption with Vagabond, is that you'll have to wait on season 2. The wait will be a minimum of 15 mos but a maximum of....well, never. I hope they never do /that/ to us!IMHO...
🎬8 🤔6 🎭7 ⚡8 💓5 🦋5.Suggested Age 12& up.

title: Vagabond
review: Definitely worth a watch - never wanted it to end. Just wasn't satisfied with the easy killings shown in final episode and hence lost a point from9 to 8 for me.

title: Vagabond
review: ETA: I finished the series a while back, and I was just a little tortured by the way it ended. If you've watched it too, you'll know what I mean. Basically I'm wishing for a season 2, but not with much hope. I still won't change my rating, because I think this is a damn good show.I feel it may be too soon to post this review, since I am still suffering through each week waiting for the next episodes to be released. Still, from the start this series hooked me in, and I'm absolutely impressed by the performances of the cast.In particular I think Lee Seung-gi is doing a phenomenal job of portraying a heartbroken uncle. He kicks ass, as does Bae Suzy as Go Hae-ri. And ooooo those bad guys are BAD.To summarise for now: it's action packed, and there is great chemistry between the two leads. Political intrigue and corruption mean that you're constantly raging against injustice, and cursing the bad dudes who you hope that karma will sort out quick smart. But there's also constant hope that good will prevail.Every episode ends on a cliffhanger, so the sooner we get to see it all, the better!

title: Vagabond
review:
I really loved this series "Vagabond" from the very beginning. It was so thrilling. You know with the plane crash 211 people died in the crash 108 Koreans. Then the secrets start to surface about the pilot being seen alive. The nephew sent a video to his uncle a passenger seen in that video seem to be alive. All I can says to you review seekers suspect everyone. The end is complex you have to get into the mind of the man to find the truth. The lady assassin knows all the sides of the story but is not a keeper of secrets.It is a block buster complex story. Watch it very carefully or you will miss something. I've finished watching "Vagabond". Loved this drama and was waiting every week for each episode in New Zealand. Outstanding with megastar actors. Then comes the shocking ending you won' t believe it. It will make you so angry. This is what I said"
Is vagabond really finished? No way! They must be one more episode surely it can't end like that. So frustrating. I was thinking to have another rant at the writers bad enough when Arthdal Chronicles ended on a cliffhanger. I tell you it better have a sequel I was so angry when the beginning first episode was actually the end. Oh its not good enough when they do this to us viewers. It is so rage inducing. I would never have watched it if I had known this.

title: Vagabond
review: I have seen my fair share of Korean dramas and while I can't say this one is my favorite, it's definitely in my top 3. The main character is so fierce and relentless. There's twists but they don't drag out forever and leave you feeling bored like most shows. Every episode something new and exciting is happening. Also it has the best special effects I've seen in a K-Drama hands down.

title: Vagabond
review: This series has great action, great drama, a good plot, and some really terrific acting (seriously, some of the actors' performances are really impressive, notably during dramatic moments. This includes some of the minor characters). The story isn't properly resolved and concluded, so I guess there will be another season (there better be..). I would have preferred to have it wrapped up, but that's how it is. It's not really a problem though, as long as they finish it later in another season.I only really have one problem with this series, but it's kind of a big one: it's fine to have several people be corrupt and/or evil, but when 90% of everyone (and I mean that. We are talking about a shitton of different people here) in any notable position of power in the entire series are eventually shown to be like that (although they certainly don't all work on the same side with each other), and even most of the good people below them knowingly commit actions they know are wrong and evil because "they are just following orders", no matter how absurd those orders are, well...it just takes all the realism out of things. I was okay with things up until about episode 8 I think, but after that, things are just taken way way too far, and it just goes downhill from there when it comes to this one particular aspect. It just becomes too outlandish and absurd. Which is a shame, 'cause otherwise the series is really good.

title: Vagabond
review: Most of the Korean series that I've watched so far focuses mainly on romance, but this is a different genre. There is plenty of action and much more twists in this series, after a couple of episodes I was hooked to the series and every episode leaves hanging on the edge of your seats. I most certainly hope that there will be a second season of this series because that's how it ends. If I was you I wouldn't miss it... Waiting for the next season!!

title: Vagabond
review: Hats off to the writers! The story was so good and the cast was superb. They executed everything so nicely and I loved the twists in the story. How everything is solved but still there's a piece of the puzzle missing! If u love thriller action mystery with little bit tint of romance, u should definitely watch this!

title: Vagabond
review: This is my 3rd korean drama series.Go to Netflix then search for Vagabond and prepare yourself for a roller coaster ride. Korean translated into English subtitles, I still love this show.If action with a bit of heart is what you want, you came to the right place. A series perfect for unwinding & enjoying.It has a lot of heart & awesome action scenes.I got hooked from the 1st until the 15th episode, but 16th episode( climax), just in one episode they wrapped it all without any end. Anyway 8/10 stars for the story & how it goes till 15th episode, the brilliant acting of the cast and the cinematography. The plot is mind-blowing and nerve-racking.The tension, suspense, action, betrayals, lies and deceit and every other thing you could feel it from head to toe. It's a masterpiece.

title: Vagabond
review: It isn't a regular type of KDrama it's completely action packed & the content wise also it's Good. Each actor in this series they just nailed it with there acting. Especially my fav BaeSuzy as GoHaeri

title: Vagabond
review: The show is good and it's worth-watching. It's produced in US style. It has a pretty good evolution of event and plenty of plot twists (not all of which on my taste, but anyway).So if you liked Matt Damon's Bourne series, you're likely going to like this one too. :)

title: Vagabond
review: When I first read the synopsis and seeing the cast list, it sounded very interesting. Sadly, despite the cast and action sequences, Vagabond failed to be a cohesive action packed film.The series began a little slow and choppy, with flashbacks and a scene we will see later on in the series. Despite this, it failed to really captivate my interest fully. As the minutes rolled by, the thin the plot began to reveal itself. By episode 6, the show was just a series of fight sequences bound together with a dragged on storyline. I have to admit, there were scenes that I skipped and it didn't make a difference to the overall plot.Also, my biggest gripe in many k series is the poorly and cringey English dialogue. I'm not talking about accents, as the cast did make an effort in Pronunciation. My gripe is the way the spoken English is delivered, it felt unnatural and awkward like it was Google translated. In this case, it really pulled me out of the show.Overall, Vagabond tried to be Jason Bourne/Die Hard but just failed to really hit the mark. If you're bored and need a mindless show, try it ....otherwise it can be skipped.

title: Vagabond
review:
I really enjoy the series.
Twisted story line is really unexpected and it make the show really worthy to watch.The main cast Lee Seung-Gi played really great acting for both action / fight and melodrama plot ( Also amazing how hard his life during filming since most storyline is about action 🙈)Well, looking fwd for session 2

title: Vagabond
review:
If you like the implausible, impossible, over-the-top action scenes with car crashes, gun-battles and martial arts you have it here.Are some scenes unrealistic and absurd?Yes.Are there plot holes?Yes.Is there an overabundance of plot twists?Yes.But, overall in spite of all the things wrong I have found that many Korean series and films do not have what I call (a baseball reference) "a closer":
some scenes, characters, or events that satisfactorily ties up loose ends and make the plot viable.Hey...it's entertaining.I find that unlike many American series (ex. "The Handmaids Tale") Korean series and films have much more regard for second and third character development. They flesh out the people, give them unique, quirky and a variety of different traits rather than USA series that only really center on the handful of main characters, who tend to be dull as dishwater anyway.

title: Vagabond
review: This show blew me away - literally. I've watched my fair share of political/action dramas and this is definitely one of the best out there.The plot is amazing, the characters are top and the acting was spot on. My adrenaline was on a high whenever I watched this show - in a good way - because there were so many plot twists and so many things happening but it was never over the top.There are two reasons why I haven't given it a 10 though:The show has some minor inconsistencies along the way, for example characters hiding from killers behind a wall while the killers keep shooting at them. The wall has windows in it though and through the windows two of the characters were obviously seen - technically the killers could've knocked them out with a simple shot through the window but they acted like their bodies were completely covered by the wall.But to be honest, these inconsistencies were so minor and didn't really influence my emotions I truly considered still giving this show a 10.But then I got to the final episode - and found out this show has an OPEN ENDING!!!!While some of the truth was uncovered and resolved, there are still many open questions and the show ended in the middle of an action-filled scene. I guess the producers of the show made it that way so a possible second season would be highly anticipated. The thing is, this show was released a year ago and so far I haven't found any official notice that the show would be renewed for a second season. And while some people don't mind open endings, I don't deal well with them.Conclusion: This show is a must!!! But beware of the open-ending and the possibility that there's never going to be a second season (even though I haven't lost hope yet). If you can't deal with open endings, I recommend to watchlist this show a little while in the hopes that its second season is going to be confirmed soon.

title: Vagabond
review: Vagabond is an amazing drama with great script and amazing performances from every single character. The main couple has nice chemistry ,but I would like to see more romantic moments between them. The action on this drama keeps you focused till the last minute. There are also so much plot twists and of course many strong moments. Amazing sceneries and direction too. I really hope and can't wait for a Season 2 !

title: Vagabond
review: Fantastic action, suspense, spy thriller! Amazing narrative, wonderful writing, exceptional cast and intriguing cinematic action scenes in every episode. Bae Suzy and Lee Seung Gi were absolute brilliant in their performance together (once again): bravo to the outstanding execution of their characters as NIS Agent Go Hae Ri and her sidekick, Cha Dal Geon. Absolutely fabulous action-packed drama! Loved it!

title: Vagabond
review: Im from the UK. Dont speak a word of korean except for watching classics like old boy. I watched this by pure chance and what a delight. It has action and emotions on a similar level to 24 season 1. I like how the first episode is funny and helps build the characters. Great must watch series. Im on episode 5 and hope it maintains the tempo. Thanks netflix.

title: Vagabond
review: I really enjoyed this drama it was amazing and so really with what is happening in our world. Thanks to the male lead actor. I can't wait to watch more seasons of it..

title: Vagabond
review: Started very promising. A plane crash initiated by a passenger is a novel idea and is fresh. And his escaping triggering the entire hunt for bad guys was good. But when people decide to get rid of him in later episodes, the entire plot falls through. Why bother taking steps to save him if he can be dispensed with !

title: Vagabond
review: Excellent action story with a lot of suspense. Great performance from all actors, in all lead and supportive roles! I watched it breathless. Waiting for Season 2! Don't miss it! :)

title: Vagabond
review: The first few episodes are gripping, but about halfway through it reverts to pantomime performances (though not all actors are guilty), incongruent attempts at romance and humour, and baffling/idiotic character behaviour.Despite this, an enjoyable and bingeable entertainment.

title: Vagabond
review: Lots of good actors, the story is gripping and the pacing is really good too.

title: Vagabond
review: The whole 13 episodes have been great and have a nice mixtures of suspense, action and some light romance too. The ending closes everything out nicely and also gives us something that can lead us to a Season 2. I hope this show does well in terms of views and rating since they really deserve it. Great story and actors. Love this. 10/10!

title: Vagabond
review: This show keeps you hooked in, I love all the characters, even the pilot (woo-gi) who we are supposed to hate, you can't help but like him and kinda feel bad for him at times. (maybe that's me)There's a mix of action, drama and some romance all in one and each episode makes you want to watch more.I've finished the series a few days ago and what happened with Emorej at the end was so satisfying and gruesome at the same time. It was spicy revenge.TL;DR: The show is great. Watch it.

title: Vagabond
review: I am a fan of good Korean dramas and I especially like Seung-gi Lee. I was surprised at how good he was as an action hero of this genre.This 16 episode series starts as a jet crashes killing (supposedly) all on board. The uncle of one of the young students killed on the plane sees video his nephew, which was sent to the cloud, taken from on the plane. By chance, one passenger on the plane (with a scar on his face) is seen by Cha Dal Geon (Seung-gi Lee) alive after the crash and the action begins.One female agent (Go Hae Ri) of NIS, comes to believe Cha, and little by little other bereaved family members start to believe the plane was deliberately sabotaged.By the end of each episode, you wonder how the good guys are going to get out of the predicament they are in, but in the next episode they do--although there is a lot of collateral damage along the way.You can see that Go Hae Ri and Cha Dal Geon are falling for each other, which is a weakness since it can be used against either of them by the enemy.My big complaint about this series is in how it ended. Each episode ended on a cliffhanger including the last episode. Does this mean there will be a 2nd season? If not, it left me very unsatisfied. I just think if you are going to put more than 16 hours into watching a series, it should have a better ending. For that reason, I would not watch this again as I have watched other favorite series more than once.I am giving it 8 out of 10 stars because I enjoyed most of this series.

title: Vagabond
review:
Loved this series. Action packed and wonderfully acted. Multiple car chases so well directed. Korean series keep getting better and better.
I didn't mind at all that the good guys were able to escape several situations where the odds were very low for surviving. I've never seen a movie or series with as many corrupt government officials as this one.
Absolutely fell in love with Suzy Bae.
She's the cutest girl ever.

title: Vagabond
review:
The story is really interesting and well written. The acting is also very good. However the end is really disappointing. Number one it's really vague and it makes the viewer curious but offers no answer (so I guess you can make your own judgment). Number two it's really dense. A lot of story happens in a short amount of time (time of the episode).
Overall I recommend it and it's a very good series

title: Vagabond
review: VAGABOND (2019)Intense. Action-packed. Thriller.Brilliant screenplay! I love the twists and turns of this drama. Made my brain cells work. All the actors were amazing!9/10I have a crush on Lee Seung-gi! He's not that guapo but full of sex appeal. Saw a couple of his works and this one is the best for me so far.

title: Vagabond
review: I am hoping that Season 2 comes soon, the story has to be finished. If I can give a score more than 10, I will do. This show is very intense non-stop action suspense mystery thriller with a lot of twists and turn and the story gets deeper and deeper...Though a very serious plot, the writer was able to inject some bits of humor and a cute romance story. The chemistry of the 2 stars is fantastic and I commend all the stars from the top to the bottom for very good acting where you will love the good guys and absolutely hate the bad guys. I have my new darling crush in SUZY BAE, youthful, charming and cute...I consider this my #1 KDrama show together with CLOY....Bravo,to this fantastic and spectacular TV series...

title: Vagabond
review: A series perfect for unwinding and enjoying, it has alot of heart and some awesome action scenes. It's funny, sad and goes at a million miles an hour with action. Its well worth the time for action buffs. Not alot better out there in any case.

title: Vagabond
review:
It's a decent show with a very good idea. It borrows a lot from spy movies in general, but pushes it too much to make it completely unbelievable. I am not talking about plot holes, but simply defying all laws of physics, logic, etc.
Without being overly analytical just to mention the case when the main characters get ambushed in a dead-end street with professional assassins on the rooftops. Bad guys armed with automatic and sniper rifles can't hit a bunch of people in a regular car not even 200m away. The good guys on the other hand, armed only with pistols, manage to hit a whole bunch of baddies on the rooftop. More laughable is how 10+ special forces crew gets outsmarted and killed by a handful of people.
No need to spoil it further. It's still watchable and it's fun, but cartoonish at times.What's extremely annoying and what some other people mentioned was the camerawork. It's so shaky that it makes it almost unwatchable at moments. Another stupid effect they're using is brightness spikes to imitate camera flashes which makes the whole show feels so cheap.Hoping for a good ending without stupid cliffhangers.

title: Vagabond
review: I like thriller and action movies very much but this one was a disappointment to me. I enjoyed the actors but there were several scenes in which the acting and the plot was just too unrealistic. I also did not like the ending and I believe it is a bad idea to make a season 2. they should have made everything in one season with 20 episodes. Too much politics involved for my taste.

title: Vagabond
review: I just wonder who made this crap and what his/her credentials are. I know this was a high-budget production, but it seems all of the money was spent on aesthetics of the show and virtually nothing for the substance. The story line could have been interesting and compelling. However, the idiotic details are just too much to handle. How can a sniper accurate shoot a small mirror, but is unable to even graze two people he's trying to kill? Another killer tries to kill an "unarmed" target by going into a convenience store and spraying the whole joint with a clumsy semi-automatic rifle. Why not wait for the target out the store with just a pistol? A guy gets shot, they pull the bullet out, and it's in pristine shape.... It goes on and on... A truly childish effort.

title: Vagabond
review: This Kdrama, is by far the best I've seen sofar, it's Action packed throughout, Great acting, great chemistry between cast, especially between the 2 main characters.Twists and Turns throughout, wasn't expecting most of it.However, this is 100% one of those Kdramas, along with a few others that need a Season 2 .. otherwise, the main bad dude gets away with it.10/10.

title: Vagabond
review: I didn't think I would like but it's a great show , it reminds me of old movies, the hero against all the odds!

title: Vagabond
review: Overall, the cast performed admirably, the scenes and characters had a decent balance of unpredictability, the script was acceptable, the action was well-choreographed, and the visual effects were convincing. Several scenes were confusing and the ending was deflated. It is not perfect, but still a fun watch.

title: Vagabond
review: The two main leads and the action we're a seven out of 10 the last two episodes were 1 out of 10 and the whole plot for the show didn't make any sense whatsoever there's no way you can make these connections and then they added so much more to the ending instead of just ending it.

title: Vagabond
review:
Finally a real action drama! Lee seung-gi snapping out of romcoms finally portraying a role that suits him best. Theres probably very little he actually cannot do, him mourning after his nephew is absolutely heartbreaking, on the other hand his composure and determination to find the culprits behind his nephew's death is admiring. He has a real talent when it comes to expressing feelings and emotions.
Bae Suzy was a great counterpart to Seung-gi, she is much younger but no doubt also very talented actress. My experience is that the kdrama directors havent always casted female leads with Seung-gi well, his overpowering, overbearing personality is hard to match, but Suzy managed extremely well.
The plot is also very good and believable. Overall i really enjoyed watching the vagabond and i hope to see them both more often in action movies/series as opposed romcoms, and who know, maybe one day in hollywood?! :)

title: Vagabond
review: BUT... once again they leave you wondering what that hell is going on. Is Hai-ri a traitor also? What? Are they going to continue the story? I have watched too many if these shows that are very good and then they just leave you hanging. Getting a little old.

title: Vagabond
review: It's more than an action serise; it's about the human spirit, it's about willing hearts that go to extreme to prove the truth, it's about the corrupts and the filth of the politics, it's about a few that can make a difference...... And it's sooo much more. Has only 16 episodes. You have to watch it!!!!!

title: Vagabond
review:
If you want something thats gonna be gripping, and highly engaging and fast paced this is the drama for you!There are no wasted scenes or drawn out moments in this drama. Solid performance by Suzy and the others and the action is totally rad and well taken.The ending is full circle but I think they might make another season. if not that would be my biggest critique because just as we think Suzy and Lee Seung-gi are about to be together they cut their relationship and Suzy thinks hes dead and moves on. I don't like this ending.
Otherwise you will love this fast paced, exhilarating Drama. Worth watching if your into action shows and such

title: Vagabond
review: OK only four episodes to this point, but I am hooked. They are released on Netflix, two episodes a week. I won't go into the premise, others will do that. I will just say that the action scenes are taught, slick and well choreographed. This is well worth following. The only criticism I have is that the "nutcase who doesn't know what he's talking about" bit, even though the terrorist incident in question should have been obvious to a blind person, is wearing thin. I hope they resolve that one quickly. Otherwise go for it.

title: Vagabond
review:
This is one of the best action kdramas ever
The story and the acting are just amazing
I love this drama soooo much
Highly recommended

title: Vagabond
review: The last 10 min of the final episode ended with a cliffhanger. WTF... Otherwise the show is amazing.

title: Vagabond
review: Storyline: The series tells about an event that was perfectly planned and drive the main character to reveal the incident.Maybe this series can relate to the real life missing aircraft nowhere to be found and the writers seems to have the idea on it alter a bit. That's what I'm thinking.Binge on watching: Yes, you want to know it all. One episode lead to another and two episode not enough to satisfy your curiosity.

title: Vagabond
review:
Imagine if you watched 24 and cared for the characters. Imagine you genuinely liked them and wanted only their well being. Imagine the characters were capable humans and not ridiculous plot device daughters possibly one of the worst crimes in TV history. Fallable likable humans that you relate to because none of them are superhuman or anything, just normal people in supernormal situations... and then imagine the program repeatedly punches you in the heart for liking them. That's Vagabond. A singilar great piece of tv, the reteaming of Lee Seung-Gi and Suzy Bae is inspired, the chemistry is brilliant. The story is great keeping you on your feet. The action feels like something out of an MI film.
The humour is brilliant placed, typically Korean and therefore aligns with Anglo and therefore actually funny, and again human. Faultless TV. Watch it.

title: Vagabond
review: Well this one is genuinely a proper action packed thriller series. There are tons of action scenes, a very strong script and some very good acting from the cast.The story is interesting and keeps you at edge of your seat. The suspense is also there till the very end of the series.But one thing you should keep in mind before watching is that the ending will keep you hanging and the story will wind up only when the second season comes so if you are planning to watch then make sure the second season is confirmed else it will be waste of time.

title: Vagabond
review:
I think I wasted 16 hours watching what will happen next..but the ending is zero with no justice served to the real culprits, no abrupt end, till episode 15 everything will be okay..but just in one episode they wrapped it up all..without any end..actually ,one will never accept how the story ends.. disappointed. Anyway 9 stars are for the story ,how it goes till 15th episode, the brilliant acting of the cast and the cinematography..16th episode is
simply waste of time...

title: Vagabond
review: One of the reasons the raid: redemption, the raid 2, Ong Bak are amazing action movies is because of the steadiness of the action shots. There nothing worse in an action/martial arts scene than shakey, over edited, multiple camera cinematography. I wanted to like vagabond. It had great potential. The characters were great. So was the acting and story. I couldn't continue after the third episode. The action/fight scenes were unbearably shakey and overedited. I'm not talk about the Borne franchise shakey, I mean the cameraman was having an epileptic fit, whilst sitting on a jackhammer. IT... WAS... TERRIBLE! Who thinks this is a good idea? Who thinks this makes for good action? Stop it! Stop it now. I couldn't believe how bad the camera shaking was. Can't see what's going on in the shot. Do better!

title: Vagabond
review: A cute couple with sweet chemistry and a plot with twists after twists after twists and then some. It's mostly fast paced and fun but the overall conspiracy at the end of it didn't make any sense... Basically for things to have worked out the way they did, the mastermind would have to have had God like qualities of omnipresence and omniscience. But nonetheless, it was a fun watch and I am not a big fan of mindless action but I did enjoy it.One major complain though, unless there is a season 2, I am unaware of, the conclusion didn't make much sense. The makers should have stuck to the fun, action genre with a sprinkle of cutsie romance and given us catharsis... Closure but no, they decided to force a Shutter Island ending on a Fast and Furious.

title: Vagabond
review:
This has to be among the best thrillers out there. Elite show. Edge of your seat type of thriller with a handful of comic moments. Amazing show with beautiful scenery (Morocco & Portugal), savage action scenes, nerve wracking moments, heartwarming moments, and great lessons to be learned. Rewatched it countless times. Got my whole family and friends to watch it, NO KIDDING😂🙌 The story is amazing, the action scenes, cinematography, the visuals, special effects, CGI, acting, chemistry, scenery and soundtrack are all amazing. Fast enough pace with countless plot twists and feels. Also this show teaches you lots of lessons on trust, teamwork, family, hope and faith.
CANT WAIT FOR SEASON II
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

title: Vagabond
review: The show was good.... Then it ended on a cliffhanger! No talks about a 2nd season either & it's been almost 2 years since the show ended. With such an extended amount of time since the ending, I doubt a 2nd season will happen.

title: Vagabond
review:
Vagabond joins the league of my favourite Korean action series such as K2, Iris and Two Weeks. Right after the plane crash in episode 1, the suspense and intensity in each episode does not stop. Every episode will keep you at the edge of your seat and that surprisingly made the show fun for me.
The pacing is very fast with lots of twists viewers will not see coming. The storyline is very heart pounding with main characters been chased in from Morocco to Korea and people trying to kill them in almost every episode.
The story ended with major answers to quetions about the plane crash but raised more questions which were not answered. Vagabond never has a dull moment with its storyline and I hope they get to make a second season as the story ended with a cliffhanger.

title: Vagabond
review: Well, this is one of the best kdrama of all time. The twists, the actions and the acting are good. If you are not familiar with kdrama, you should watch this. Some of the episodes may be boring to you. But watch it to the end. You'll gonna love it.

title: Vagabond
review: I never thought that this masterpiece of series can hold me.I love the the scenes from morocco tanger and the changes of the scenery'sThe actors are great and I like the story twists so much.You never now the true every time you think this vagabond change the rules.Conclusion:Whe need more 😄🤙🏽

title: Vagabond
review: Nice drama, it keeps the attention high until the end. Unfortunately the last episode ruined everything. Or is it not the end? Will a season 2 ever follows?

title: Vagabond
review:
Korean thrillers are notable for their subtlety, cleverness and clever drama. Their beautifully choreographed battles and shoot outs. Their exceptional cinematography.
This series completely lacks all of these qualities. None of it makes any sense. At many points I wondered if it was trying to be a parody. Do not waste your time. Try K2 or Iris or Man to Man for something worth watching.

title: Vagabond
review: I watched two episodes and just found the whole premise childish. Will appeal to a teenage audience.

title: Vagabond
review: The series was just awesome! The actions the stunts the graphics, casting and story well, but there comes time where there is too much drama just hard to bear. Otherwise it would be an 8 * also this is a must watch and one of the best korean series I watched can't wait for another season. And Please don't drag the episodes too much this time 👏🏻

title: Vagabond
review: Amazing amazing amazing! The stunts are of international level!!! Waiting for Season 2!!!

title: Vagabond
review: Great performances. Good chemistry between the actors. Story was great, lots of twists and turns. But, the last episode was a cliffhanger and the story ended with a LOT of open questions. Now, I'm searching for any news of when season 2 will come out with no success. There's no commitment from the producers that there will be another season. If I knew this show would leave me hanging I would have avoided it.

title: Vagabond
review: First thing first... when is SEASON 2 coming :)This is an amazing Korean series, filled with a great thrilling storyline, great actors and overall super direction. It binds you well from the first episode and you will feel like it should never end. Lots and lots of twist and turns during the series follows but what remain exciting is the next scene. Got for it people, even if you are not native Korean (Like I am not).. this is still worth your time to be watched with English Subs.

title: Vagabond
review: Without any expectation started to watch this series. Best korean drama with action packed stunts.. Stunt man vs the Korean government superb execution from the team. Both male and female role just rocked their acting. Don't miss this if you love a action packed suspense thriller.

title: Vagabond
review: Good plot. Politics, Espionage, Assassins and a little bit of love story. Nothing to yawn about the love story. The action is okay. Many unbelievable scenes and overseas settings. It could use a Part 2 Second Season.

title: Vagabond
review: Minor defect? Yeah. I found a flaw in the ending of this drama where the conflict hangs. But overall is good.

title: Vagabond
review: Please continue with this show come out with more episodes. All hail season 2!!!!!!

title: Vagabond
review: I love the main actors but the female villains are seriously cringe worthy. Especially their English. It makes the show get downright cheesy at many points. The female assassin was the worst part of the whole show. Terrible acting and i couldn't understand her at ALL when she spoke in English... why did they do that?? It was hard to get past. The action was great they definitely spared no expense but the show felt like it lacked substance after the first few episodes. Wasn't the worst... wasn't the best. If it wasn't Seung Gi i would have given it a 4 tbh.

title: Vagabond
review: Lots of reviewers rave about this series. To each his own.I will just say that after 16 episodes you are left with a cliffhanger and a completely unresolved plot and thus far there is no sign of a second season. Don't waste your time with it as you will only feel like you have been cheated. If they ever produce a second season then consider watching it.

title: Vagabond
review: He's penniless. Where does he get the money from to cover all those expenses?

title: Vagabond
review: Hands down the first episodes were 10/10 but after a while the action was just ridiculous, but still it was a great series. But the ending... So horrible!!!! I can't express how disappointing the last episode was!

title: Vagabond
review:
Overall it's good. Actors fit their roles, mix of exciting and sentimental moments...but some writing issues are really getting on my nerves, like some other review said, too much things happen for the starting plot to have been an "accident" main characters are constantly getting in the cross hairs and don't even tell about it to back up their evidence. Also a hitman claims to have been sent to kill and make it look like suicide", and his method is to strangle with a string?....yes totally look like suicide...come on!?? more things like this happens that just make you frustrated, especially how they handle evidence and just say parts of all info they have to back it up and not all.
Still it makes me want to see more because of the general storyline and performance of actors

title: Vagabond
review:
The male lead is a stuntman with martial arts background loses his nephew in an airplane crash. the female lead is the rookie agent working for national intelligence service.
This happens in the context of two companies fighting for a 1 trillion dollar bid to sell military aircrafts to the govt. show is about how these two investigates the who and why behind the crash and bring to justice.An interesting part of the show is the guessing game it plays with the viewer who is the bad guy, who is the mastermind. It delves into politics, self-interests, bureaucracy, lobbying.While the hero is an emotional dumbass, heroine that brings common sense, charm and feminine brightness to the show.
Having mixed drama in thriller plot brings lag especially after 5 episodes however, it is worth watching.

title: Vagabond

title: Vagabond
review: Bored with Netflix and Prime offerings I decided to try out some non-European/American series ... io and behold, I wish I'd tried Asian series before ! Of all those I saw, I think Vagabond is my favourite series. It has everything I like in a series, some good action, betrayal, villains you'd love to punch in the nuts, and romance. Not that there was a lot of it, but the budding romance between the main leads was a joy to watch, especially thanks to Bae Suzy who's simply amazing in all aspects.

title: Vagabond
review: So first of all, it started really good, but the first thing I noticed was the action scenes. They shake all over the place, why? As for me, a person who always looks for the details in action scenes got so disturbed by the shaky editing. I know the scene should be exciting, but you just took that away on all of the scenes because of it.Besides that, everyone fits in their roles quite well, but then again. The script writers should definitely look for more inspiration if the main lead constantly fails in everything that he does, and why does it seem like he lacks intelligence.. Some decisions were cringe worthy to be honest. Kept asking myself: why? Some logical thinking and everything could probably solved the first few episodes, but I guess that's why they stretch the number of episodes with a dumb script for the main lead.But that's my personal opinion into 3 episodes. I might edit this review after watching everything, but by the looks of the consistent shaking scenes, I don't think so.

title: Vagabond
review:
Omg !!!!!!!! This drama 🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥🔥!!!First of all , I NEED A SEASON TWO RIGHT NOW !!!!!!! But im hoping they would bring a season 2 coz why not , its netflix , and the show is awesome , the actors are fabulous , the story is bombarding so why not ?!Starting with the story, it started off pretty simple like a orphan nephew and his uncle living together surviving by fits and starts but they were happy until one day...TRAGEDY! The nephew dies in a plane crash and we're like okay thts really sad they made us weep in the first episode, but when we get to know tht its a conspiracy and the plan crash was nothing but an act pulled off by some powerful crackhead peoples for their own profit, killing thousands of innocent people and giving their family grief for their entire lives !!!! Im like go main lead kill them all !!!!💥
The actors did a wonderful job, everyone ! The protagonists did their very best fighting for justice and the antagonists tried everything they could to stop them ! It was a cat and mouse game but rather with lots of action, guns and bombs! I loved our main lead he was so good !!! *Chefs kiss* and I really have to thank the writers bcz the push behind the main lead to fight all those ppl was very strong , strong enough to drive us ! Anyone who loses his child would do the same thing as cha dal geon. Although he was his nephew he was like his own child to him.I loved our female lead , how can someone be so badass and cute amd beautiful at the same time ! Man !!! I loved whenever suzy spoke spanish!!! I really loved the chemistry between our leads !!! There were not so many scenes but still I want more of them!Rest I loved all the NIS agents !!! Especially our chicken shop 😂 and our mr.hacker guy!This drama has humor , amazing story line ,plot twists, romance, emotions , and lots of thriller and action!!!! Not to mention the wonderful osts ! And amazing cinematography!!!!While u watch this show I just wanna advice to guys to not trust anybody ! And when I say ANYBODY I mean it !!! I would highly , highly very highly recommend you to watch this masterpiece! Go and watch it now !!!!!! And yeah if u dont have a netflix subscription u can watch it here : dramacool.ai thank me later😉

title: Vagabond
review: Although Vagabond had numerous plot holes large enough to drive a truck through, the action was great and I enjoyed the romance angle. In fact I've become a real fan of Bae Suzy thanks to this drama. However the last episode ruined the entire series for me. It seemed like they ran out of time or money and shot scenes that jumped around without bothering to explain how the characters got to this point. What was more troubling is that both of the lead charaters took 90 degree turns. After carefully showing how Cha Dal Geon and Go Hae Ri evolved through the first 15 episodes, the last episodes portrayed them as almost totally different people, doing things that seemed totally "out of character" for them without any explanation for why or how they changed. I was also very disappointed by the lack of emotional payoff - I came away feeling empty.

title: Vagabond
review:
Just finished ep 14. I saw LSG n Suzy (Main characters) said romance is only spoonful in this drama n that the shooting locations was in Morocco, Portugal n South Korea. So i really hope there will be a season 2 soon. Both leads carry the drama so good n tbh i couldn't wait for the next 2 episodes. So many unanswered questions which i dont think could fit in just 2 episodes.
1. What is PM Hong's true intention
2. Who is Samael
3. Hae-ri's story at the beginning of ep 1.
4. Why Dal Geon became a sniper.
5. Lawyer Hong's plot
6. N Vagabond itself - why n what Chief Kang n GI Tae Woon set it up for in the first place?As per ep 14., i believe Jessica is a pawn for the Hongs n i wonder if edward Park is also in the game. I truly hope for more romantic scenes between the leads cos i ship them so hard since Gu Family Book but i am happy so far with this drama n hoping n praying for more episodes. 💖💖💖21st Nov. I did some research while rewatching ep 3. The person holding Jerome was wearing this hat that has batch similar to ROYAL MOROCCAN ARMY. I Think the army guy took order from Samael. My suspicion is Samael is Edward Park. N he was the 1 keeping CDG alive so whatever his plot will be carried out. Vengeance could be the motivation.

title: Vagabond
review:
For the love of watching series, i would definitely say it is an action packed that will really keep you on the edge of your seat, scences to make you feel your adrenaline rush. Every episode's ending is indeed a cliff hanger, bringing strong aspect of suspense, questions, doubts. finally, something you could say thank god it's not about love, romance or rom-com, fantasy, that are common in kseries. But i love their witty humor, their transition from a serious scene/script shifting to a comical one, they always have the right timing in it to blow a nice humour., i guess that is always their charm. For those saying that it is unrealistic must say the same thing on john wick. If you want realistic, watch biography or documentaries. Lol. When did an action genre comes too real? I mean, you have to consider the possibilities., yes the scene where they were ambushed was quite impossible, and when they are trying to bring the witness to the court as well, but hey! Like i said, in an action genre, you really cannot deny unrealistic ingredients in it. The depth of the story isn't that much at first but when they are getting too close to the truth, it shows and will end up in political motives. i would still give it a go and recommend it because of the thripoor suspense it gives you and the twist it tells you.
Cinematography wise in a series?, i've never had a better look than that of the peaky blinders' cinematography. It's one of the best. Not talking about big screens or movies in cinema. Just in series. For vagabond, the shaky effect of the camera during some of the action scenes is not really helping. They must really change or come up with a better idea rather than intentionally shaking the camera upon action taking., it annoys me as well. But that's it, other than that, nothing. Your time will not be wasted.

title: Vagabond
review: The Vagabond series tells the story itself, starting with Shadagon Stuntman, a young man who is involved in a tragic plane crash. In that flight, his only grandson was traveling with him. This incident was involved in national corruption. Leading to a global corporate network that caused this loss on the other hand, our young heroine, Gohairi, works as a foreign intelligence service. Under the National Security Service (NIS) until she accidentally met the hero Chadagon. During the investigation of the case of the plane crash. The pair must find a way to survive in a country full of killers who are hunting to silence this terrorism.As for the actor's hand ghost, Lee Seung Gi must say that he is doing really well. Well, roles of both action and drama have broken up. Considered very attractive when it comes to personal scenes when joining the scene with the heroine Bae Suzy. They are developing relationships gradually on the rise. From the very beginning that the male protagonist did not trust the heroine until when they both began to open up until it became a love that was just right in the drama line like this but I must say that the boys who have met such beautiful female protagonists more and more in the role of a spy who is both smart and good. You will definitely love her from the beginning. Vagabond series has been used in scenes from many countries. Korean, Portuguese, and Moroccan, the set design productions are stunning and instantly look like a giant series. The more it combines with the various action scenes, it is considered fun and fun, although some scenes or some characters do not look realistic and do not make sense. But the taste of fun is considered to be in the level of almost 10 ever and can be thrilled at every episode. Which now just ended the first season only, causing a lot of fans to watch and watch.While Vagabond isn't exactly the latest to Netflix, it is still at the forefront of the hit series, and every review site recommends it. Those who like a full-fledged movie with action, drama, romance and mystery that needs to be answered until the end of the story. It is one of the few Korean dramas that can hit the global market and it has also been recognized by audiences around the world as being stunning for all reasons. Season 2 is coming soon. It is very good. I will be looking forward to another vagabond return.

title: Vagabond
review: A stunt man sets out to avenge the death of his nephew, uncovering a massive conspiracy along the way.The first episode felt like a bit of a drag, I kept wondering why bits weren't cut , and then recognising someone from mobile phone footage seen a week or so prior seemed like a huge stretchbut once the action kicked in, all was pretty much forgiven.And let's set the record straight: the action is what we'll all watch it for albeit, the eye-candy of the female lead is a nice bonusI have watched the entire first series and I can tell you that some of them contain too much content, making the story too confusing, with the seeming knowledge of the episodes being almost completely funny for no reason or should. Is it too love or where? The storyline too much or the action looks too ridiculous. But overall, it's a good series that's well worth the time, having fun at some point, and it's deep to explore.However, this series could be a bit more rigorous - one or two episodes could easily be shaved off for a cut that's likely to be made - but with a fun storyline and lovable heroine, I would still rate it. Good with this movieThis movie caught my attention from start to finish. (As I was in control) and many people ignore all the worries I am talking about simply because TV and movie theaters are full of things these days! This might explain all the top 10 ratings you'll see here, even though Vagabond is just an entertaining series. But it can easily be skipped.

title: Vagabond
review: This series started with a bang and never stopped. I nearly binged it all before I realized it, the skip ahead was never a thought, every episode kept me on the edge of my seat. Well paced action that doles out the suspense and the who done did it in a very engaging way. Definitely worth the watch.

title: Vagabond
review:
I really wanted to like this but it is so so unrealistic. Every time something happens I get frustrated because that's not how that works.
They could have put more effort into a compelling story line but instead they created a completely laughable unrealistic joke.

title: Vagabond
review: Most people like this thus the high rating so i tried watching it.i'm on ep 8 but sad to say i am having a hard time watching this. the plot is good and very promising unfortunately most of the other things are bad for me.acting is badlead actor is too hot tempered and just keeps on shouting practically at everyone. how can you convince people to believe you if you keep shouting and picking fights with themstorytelling is badthings jump from 1 thing to another too suddenlythe build up to a suspense usually fails miserablythey come up with doubts and conclusions without setting the groundwork properlya lead actor who can't even pay rent and had to think very hard buying new shoes for his nephew suddenly has the money to buy his own plane ticket back to Moroccolead guy and girl doesn't jive in their characterscamera is too shaky in so many parts it'll make your head spini'll try to add more when i remember them... sorry for bad review but these opinions are hust my own

title: Vagabond
review: Was going to rate it with a 9 stars but the ending is so out there, I mean anyone could imagine anything... There is not a proper ending to the series and also many questions remain unanswered. If a season 2 is coming out then OK, otherwise its very confusing how the story ends.Besides that, great series! I recently begun to watch k-drama/romance series and this one was a great alternative action series with very good acting and very good scenario & scenes.
