title: Vagabond
review: I have never seen a show that bring so many emotions at the same time like this show. It has everything which is pretty hard to mix crime love friendship loyalty it has a little bit of everything which makes it the best. It has been a long time since I have watch a show so worth it like this one. It is so good that I am taking the time to rate it since I want to watch season 2. Awesome 👏 show.

title: Vagabond
review:
Honestly there are many things that don't make sense in this series, the acting is wacky many times and not natural at all, the story itself is used up in korean dramas and movies, but with some special touches here and there..
In order to make Dal-gun a hero, they sacrificed all the other characters, no special agent even though they are armed can beat him, they don't shoot him as ordered because he said he will blow them up if he doesn't stop the timer, which is stupid, just shoot him and stop the timer yourself, he gets in the way of NIS investigations but they let him be even though they can arrest him for interfering with official missions.

title: Vagabond
review: In simpler words-An amazing show in every possible way.

title: Vagabond
review: I rate this k-drama 7/10 and here is why.This drama had potential to become a 9/10 but sadly plateaed after the 2nd episode and remained an intense, action drama with little time dedicated for character development or romance.The storyline alludes to Ki Tae Woong's potential love for Go Hae Ri yet we, the audience do not know whether Go Hae Ri's kiss at the staff dinner party early in the drama is out of love or purely because she is drunk. This exact same situation occured with Cha Dal Geon and it is only at the very end of this drama that the audience have a definite conclusion, that she loves Cha Dal Geon and not Cha Dal Geon.Why does Lilly listen to Jessica Lee's orders when she dosn't have any money left in jail to pay her? Why is she still working with Kim Do Su? These are the charater development sacrificed for a drama with nothing more than action.There are several major plot holes such as in ep 14, the question I had was; how did Oh Sang Mi know Cha Dal Geon's phone number in order to call him?English words where often overused and made the drama 'fragmented' in the sense that it detached the audienence from what is really going on within the drama. I find that an occasionaly use of English words compliments a k-drama such as when korean actors are talking with English investors, but not to other korean actors or not as often as the question; do we just settle with the assumption that all of them know English? aroused within me.The overall storyline was also heavily predictable and contributed to this drama being slightly less enjoyable. A way to make it more exciting for me would have been either focus on developing Kim Do Su as a love triangle with Cha Dal Geon and Go Hae Ri more in the storyline, or make Lilly a main cast and go with a plotline along Cha Dal Geon being a ex-military soldier turned stunt-man where certain events developes a love relationship between him and Lilly, who turnes 'good'.A thing which defines k-drama is its OST music which often becomes a hit in korea music charts. This drama lacks this critical element and I suppose it is yet again due to character developent being sacrificed for a more action/suspense drama.On a final note, more character development is needed, OST music is essential and lacking in this drama and apparent plot holes have made be the score this drama a 7/10

title: Vagabond
review: If you don't wanna regret, then don't miss it.One of the masterpiece i have ever seen. It contain the suspence in every episode.Mind blowing action and thrill. Desparetly waiting for season 2 cause in the ending of the season 1, it left us in a sea of thousand of question's.

title: Vagabond
review: This series takes the game to a whole new level !The scenario is fast-paced, and the action is breathtaking. Each character has its own charm, especially the protagonist : he show incredible resources and instinct in situations where he is clearly dominated. Moreover the actors do a very good job in showing emotions, and making the viewer feel them with his own guts. From sadness to anger, you get it all.This show also depicts a sad truth about political and economical powers, from complete disregard to the citizen they are supposed to represent, to oversized greed and of course the never ending obsession of power.Please watch this show, you will not regret a single minute of it !
